What is Motor Vehicle Theft?

Motor vehicle theft (sometimes referred to as grand theft auto by the media and police departments in the US) is the criminal act of stealing or attempting to steal a motor vehicle (such as an automobile, truck, bus, coach, motorcycle, or snowmobile, trailer).

Motor vehicle theft happens too often to be ignored. Some people only have liability insurance, so when their car is stolen, it’s a complete total loss. {% content_spinner "motor1" "Too often|All too often|A lot of times" %} people carry valuable items in their vehicle so the loss of their car may be even more.

Prevent your Car Being Stolen in {{ city }}, {{ state_long }}

You might not be able to stop a criminal from stealing your car if you’re not looking but there are a few things you can do to {% content_spinner "motor2" "avoid|defend|stop" %} your vehicle from becoming a target. You can park in a well-lit area. You can also avoid leaving valuables out in the open on your seats, such as laptops, navigation adapters, and other items that may be of interest to vandals.

A good and cost efficient way to avoid losing your vehicle completely can be something as simple as placing a monitored GPS device on your vehicle. these small devices allow you to track your vehicle on your phone or computer. It also provides alerts if your car has left a preset area or is above a set speed limit.
